intro: Collania guadelupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe collania, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Guadalupe in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
